msContents.summary: Through his secretaries a tax collector, Psansnos, has had poll-tax and tax concerning the dikes collected

msItemStruct.note: The O.Lund. inv. no is the number (written directly on the ostracon) given to each ostracon already by prof. Carl Schmidt, Berlin.
O.Lund. inv. no 23 = Tsiparis' publ.no 4 = Knudtzon's publ.no 27
Top right damaged; brown; text partly effaced on the left; crystallized salt; verso ribbed, black in the rifles
7 lines on the recto; verso blank ("L…" written in pencil, modern)
Mentions the name Psen(..), son of Psen.zisio(s) and grandson of Psenpanas; Ai..(os)? (scribe)
Dates mentioned: Jan. 4th 123 A.D.; Febr. 28th 123 A.D.; March 23rd 123 A.D.

provenance.p: According to the introduction to his licentiate dissertation Erik J. Knudtzon had acquired the ostracon collection through prof. Carl Schmidt, antiquities dealer and professor of Coptic studies in Berlin. Carl Schmidt, in his turn, had probably bought them in Cairo. In a letter from October 6th 1931 Schmidt writes from Berlin to Albert Wifstrand in Lund that he has aquired a small collection of 32 ostraca from Thebes, Fayum, letters and receipts, and that he is willing to sell these ostraca for the amount of 250 German marks. In a letter dated September 11th 1934 from Erik Knudtzon in Lund, most likely to professor Schubart in Berlin, we can read that Knudtzon bought the ostraca through Carl Schmidt at the same time, i.e. in 1932, as the university library in Lund bought the papyrus collection (registered in 1933 among acquisitions), also from Carl Schmidt. In 2009 Lund University Library acquired the collection, at that time owned by the Department of Archaeology and Ancient History at the same university.

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: (Tsiparis' translation) Psansnos, Geldsteuereintreiber des Memnoneia-Bezirkes, vertreten durch Psen…, dem Psen.zisis, Sohn des Psenpanas. Ich habe für Kopfsteuer des 7. Jahres 4 Drachmen erhalten. Im 7. Jahr Hadrians des Herrn, am 9. Tybi. Am 4. Phamenoth 8 Drachmen. Desgleichen durch Ai…os, den Sekretär, 4 Drachmen. Für Dammsteuer des 4. Jahres 4 Drachmen. Desgleichen ……… 4 Drachmen. Desgleichen im 8. Jahr, am 6. Thoth für Kopfsteuer noch 3 Drachmen, zwei Obolen, zwei Chalkoi (einschliesslich des Zuschlages) entsprechend dem Normalsatz von 3 Drachmen und 4 Chalkoi.

listBibl.bibl: Ostraca Lundensia (O. Lund.). Ostraka aus der Sammlung des Instituts für Altertumskunde an der Universität zu Lund, herausgegeben und kommentiert von Christos Tsiparis, Lund 1979, doctoral dissertation Ostraca Lundensia, herausgegeben und bearbeitet von Erik J. Knudtzon, Lund 1933 (1946), licentiate dissertation, not printed Gallazzi, C., Bibliotheca orientalis, 39, 1982, c. 574; Gallazzi, C., Ostraka greci del Museo egizio del Cairo (O.Cair.GPW), Papyrologica Florentina, XIV, 1986, p. 129; Sijpesteijn, P. J., Further remarks on some imperial titles in the papyri, Zeitschrift für Papyrologie und Epigraphik, 45, 1982, p. 182; Nachtergael, G., Sur la provenance de quelques ostraca de la Collection de Lund, Ricerche di egittologia e di antichità copte 6, 2004, p. 91 (provenance); Dieter Hagedorn, Die griechischen Ostraka der Heidelberger Papyrus-Sammlung, bearbeitet von Charikleia Armoni, James M. S. Cowey und Dieter Hagedorn, Veröffentlichungen aus der Heidelberger Papyrus-Sammlung, Neue Folge, Herausgegeben von der Heidelberger Akademie der Wissenschaften, Philosophisch-historische Klasse, 11, Heidelberg 2005, p. 181 (line 5), 184 (line 1); BL VIII, 522 (lines 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7); BL IX, 387 (line 7); TM 74868
